page.title: 06Education in Pennington
page.content: Pennington School is different from other schools because it is'nt built in a village. It is built in a field between the villages of Swarthmoor and Loppergarth. This is how it got there: In 1870 the government said that every village had to make a school.Neither the people in Swarthmoor nor those in Loppergarth had enough money for a school so they put their money together and asked the government in London if they could build one school between the two villages.The government said yes.The Duke ofBuccleugh gave the poor a field,the farmers brought the stones and the people built the school.The school opened on 25th March1876.It now has an old part and a new Infant block,built in 1972.There are 6 teachers,2 caretakers,a secretary and 5 dinner-ladies.
